title: NFL trade grades: Sizing up deals for Jakobi Meyers, Logan Wilson and Jaelan Phillips
content: Let's size up deals leading into the Tuesday NFL trade deadline, including the Jaguars grabbing a receiver.

title: Sources: Colts adding CB Gardner in blockbuster
content: The Colts have pulled off a blockbuster trade ahead of Tuesday's deadline, acquiring All-Pro CB Sauce Gardner from the Jets for first-round picks in 2026 and '27 and WR AD Mitchell.

title: Cowboys trade for Wilson, hope LB bolsters D
content: The Dallas Cowboys have acquired veteran linebacker Logan Wilson in a trade with the Cincinnati Bengals.

title: Jags snag Meyers in deadline deal with Raiders
content: The Raiders have traded WR Jakobi Meyers to the Jaguars in exchange for fourth- and sixth-round draft picks.

title: Source: Saints trading WR Shaheed to Seahawks
content: Receiver Rashid Shaheed, who has 44 catches for 499 yards this season, is being traded from the Saints to the Seahawks, a source told ESPN.

title: Sources: Cubs lefty Imanaga set to be free agent
content: The Cubs and Shota Imanaga both rejected their contract options, making the left-hander a free agent.

title: Morant mum on feelings after return from ban
content: Grizzlies star Ja Morant returned from his one-game suspension and had 18 points and 10 assists in a loss to the Pistons.

title: Coste, world's oldest Olympian, dies at age 101
content: Charles Coste, a gold medalist in cycling at the 1948 Games in London and the world's oldest living Olympian, has died. He was 101.

title: Opening CFP first-round game to start at 8 ET
content: The College Football Playoff, ESPN and TNT on Tuesday announced the schedule of first-round games, starting Dec. 19.

title: The real Azzi Fudd?  'None of you have seen it'
content: The Most Outstanding Player of last year's Final Four has shown her peak powers only in small glimpses. Now Azzi Fudd is ready to level up for the Huskies' repeat bid.

title: Why aren’t the Packers dominating? Are we overrating J.J. McCarthy again? Solak takes another look at Week 9
content: Ben Solak sizes up the underperforming Packers, J.J. McCarthy's return, what could happen at the trade deadline and some Week 9 trends to watch.

title: Power Rankings: 1-32 poll, plus each team's most important remaining game
content: Let's update our countdown ahead of Week 10 and pick out a critical game on the schedule for every team.

title: Why the Cavaliers are doubling down despite two straight playoff disappointments
content: After two disappointing playoff exits, the Cavaliers aren't making any major changes to their schemes or plans. In fact, they're doubling down.

title: Are the Spurs actually a contender? Debating four early-season storylines
content: ESPN national analysts Zach Kram and Kevin Pelton debate the biggest early-season questions about Victor Wembanyama, Austin Reaves, Cooper Flagg and more.

title: MLB All-October team: The stars who ruled the 2025 playoffs
content: From playoff breakouts to World Series heroes, here's a full squad of players who shined brightest under the postseason lights.

title: From Kyle Schwarber to Alex Bregman: Best fits for top free agents
content: Free agency starts Thursday at 5 p.m. ET. Here are some pairings we'd love to see as this winter gets underway.

title: Big night for freshmen, more surprises and takeaways from men's openers
content: Koa Peat's 30 points in the Wildcats' win over the reigning champs highlights big night of freshmen debuts.

title: NHL Awards Watch: Eichel leading for MVP after one month
content: We polled PHWA voters to find out who's ahead in the major races after one month of the 2025-26 season.

title: Trade Deadline Buzz: Rashid Shaheed to Seattle, to split targets with Cooper Cupp
content: Fantasy football impact of every NFL Trade Deadline deal, including Jakobi Meyers and Rashid Shaheed.

title: Predicting the rest of the Premier League season: How all 20 teams will finish
content: After 10 games, we now have enough data to predict every Premier League team's final spot in the standings for the 2025-26 season.

title: How much do Barça depend on Pedri? With midfielder injured, we're about to find out
content: Pedri's injury comes at a critical time for Barcelona and Spain, both of whom rely on his unique skills.

title: First bets for Week 10: Browns and Eagles to cover in Week 10, plus an MVP pick
content: What lines offered immediate value once odds came out? Here are four early bets and a futures wager to track.

title: Is Logan Paul replacing Seth Rollins in The Vision?
content: Heading toward Survivor Series: WarGames next month, CM Punk and The Usos isn't the only alliance taking form.

title: Pickups: Ryan Rollins, Quentin Grimes add instant offense
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Transfer rumors, news:  Napoli 'aggressively pushing' for Man United's Mainoo
content: A midseason move for Manchester United midfielder Kobbie Mainoo is in Napoli's sights. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Prashant Kishor: X Factor, Spoiler Or An Also-Ran? A Breakdown
content: The already complicated political landscape of Bihar has become even more complex this time with the entry of poll strategist-turned-politician Prashant Kishor and his Jan Suraaj party.

title: Yogi Adityanath Bans Deployment Of Cops Who Make Reels At Sensitive Sites
content: Yogi Adityanath on Monday directed that the state's police personnel who make social media "reels" at sensitive locations should not be deployed there, stressing that discipline and decorum must be maintained.

title: Sculpture Of Trump Strapped To A Cross Displayed In Switzerland
content: A realistic-looking sculpture of Donald Trump in an orange jumpsuit and strapped to a cross has stirred discussion -- and smiles -- in Switzerland, where it went on display this week.

title: Meta Rejects French Rights Watchdog's Ruling Against Algorithm
content: Meta Platforms on Tuesday rejected a ruling by the French rights watchdog against its algorithm after allegations of discriminatory job advertisements on its social network Facebook.

title: Apple To Enter Low-Cost Laptop Market With Budget Mac: Report
content: Apple is preparingto launch a budget Mac in the first half of next year, entering the low-cost laptop market for the first time, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday.

title: Stray Dogs Bite 11 In Ujjain In 2 Days, Including Man Sleeping In His Room
content: The menace of stray dogs in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain is spiralling, with 11 people being bitten in one area alone in just two days, including a man who was sleeping inside his home.

title: Cement Maker Lafarge On Trial In France Over Alleged Funding To Islamic State
content: Cement conglomerate Lafarge went on trial in France Tuesday, accused of paying the Islamic State group and other jihadists protection money to build its business in war-torn Syria.

title: Man, 43, Lynched By Roommates For Not Getting Food From Restaurant In Mumbai
content: A 43-year-old man was allegedly beaten to death by his roommates over a trivial issue in the eastern suburbs here, police said on Tuesday.

title: Man, 30, Dies By Suicide Over Error In ID Proof Amid Ongoing Bengal SIR: Cops
content: A 30-year-old man in West Bengal's Howrah district died allegedly by suicide on Tuesday, as he was reportedly distressed over errors in his identity document amid the ongoing Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls, a police officer said.

title: 60% Rise In Eye Problems As Toxic Smog Engulfs Delhi: Doctors
content: A thick blanket of smog and toxic air hanging over Delhi has triggered a sharp rise in eye-related ailments like allergies, dryness, burning sensations, and excessive watering, affecting both adults and children, according to the city's doctors.

title: Maharashtra Opposition Leaders Meet Poll Officials Over Voter List Concerns
content: A delegation of Maharashtra opposition leaders met the Central Election Commission (CEC) today, raising concerns over alleged irregularities in the voter lists and transparency in the electoral process.

title: CBI Conducts Raids In Disproportionate Assets Case Against Senior Punjab Cop
content: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Tuesday carried out extensive search operations in connection with a Disproportionate Assets (DA) case registered against Harcharan Singh Bhullar, Deputy Inspector General (DIG), Punjab.

title: China-Built Hangor Submarines To Join Pakistan Navy Fleet By 2026: Report
content: Pakistan's ambitious Hangor-class submarine programme, a centrepiece of the China-Pakistan naval partnership, is on track for induction in 2026, according to Admiral Naveed Ashraf, Chief of Naval Staff of the Pakistan Navy.

title: 'Train Overshot Red Signal': Railways On Likely Cause Of Chhattisgarh Crash
content: Hours after a local passenger train collided with a goods train near Bilaspur station in Chhattisgarh claiming six lives, the Railway Board on Tuesday said the accident took place as the passenger train seems to have overshot a red signal.

title: "Bihar Has Discovered 'HIRA' Under BJP-Led Coalition": JP Nadda
content: BJP president Jagat Prakash Nadda on Tuesday used the acronym 'HIRA', which means diamond in Hindi, to highlight the growth witnessed in Bihar under the NDA rule, especially in road, rail, air and internet connectivity.

title: Delhi's Air Getting Cleaner? Today's Air Quality Figure Best In 7 Years
content: Delhi recorded its cleanest air in seven years today, with the city's Air Quality Index or AQI reading at 291 -- significantly better than 381 in 2024 and 415 in 2023, shows official data from the Environment Department.

title: Security Forces Destroy Maoist Weapons Factory In Chhattisgarh Forest
content: Security forces have destroyed a weapons manufacturing facility of Maoists located in dense forest in Chhattisgarh's Sukma district, and seized 17 firearms along with a huge cache of equipment used in production, a police official said on Tuesday.

title: Rajya Sabha MP's Aide Among Those Arrested Over Cyber Frauds: Reports
content: A 25-year-old man, reportedly the personal assistant of a Rajya Sabha MP from Kerala, has been arrested as part of the massive state-wide operation against organised cyber-financial crimes, police said.

title: "Nobody Bigger Than Institution": Mehli Mistry's Exit Note Quotes Ratan Tata
content: Putting a "quietus on speculative news" about his role, businessman Mehli Mistry, a trustee of Tata Trusts whose term was not renewed last week, today made it official, saying he is "parting ways" with Tata Trusts.

title: Ahead Of COP30, UN Warns World Still Off Track To Meet Paris Climate Goals
content: A UN report has delivered a wake-up call - there has been progressoncutting greenhouse gases,butnot nearly enough to avoid a hotter, riskier future.

title: Action sought after photo of inspector celebrating birthday with history-sheeters in Yadgir goes viral
content: A photograph of an inspector in Yadgir district allegedly celebrating his birthday with history-sheeters has gone viral on social media drawing strong reaction from members of Dalit organisations who have sought action against him

title: Ensuring clean environment to the next generation is everyone’s responsibility, says KSPCB chairman
content: MLA and chairman of Karnataka State Pollution Control Board P.M. Narendraswamy has said that passing on clean environment the next generation was responsibility of everyone and there should be collective contribution towards reducing pollution and people should use eco friendly vehicles

title: Adoptions of girls outnumber those of boys in Kalaburagi district
content: In a remarkable shift in adoption trends, female children are adopted at a higher rate than male children in Kalaburagi district over the past six years, according to the Department of Women and Child Welfare

title: Ahmedabad’s Atal Bridge attracts 77.7 lakh visitors, generates ₹27 crore revenue
content: Between April and October 2025, the bridge received 8.51 lakh visitors and collected ₹4.82 crore in revenue

title: Suvendu Adhikari leads ‘Parivartan Yatra’ rally, demands ‘proper’ execution of SIR in West Bengal
content: This comes on the on the same day that Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee held a rally in Kolkata against the SIR process

title: Kerala University PhD scholar alleges caste bias, abuse of power by Sanskrit department head
content: He accuses the HoD of attempting to sabotage his PhD evaluation by falsely claiming that he does not know Sanskrit

title: Tejashwi vows to transfer ₹30,000 on Makar Sankranti if INDIA bloc comes to power
content: Tejashwi Yadav also announces that farmers would be given ₹300 per quintal of paddy and ₹400 for wheat as a bonus over Minimum Support Price (MSP), if the INDIA bloc comes to power in Bihar

title: Minister promotes Andhra Pradesh tourism at World Travel Market 2025 in London
content: Durgesh showcases State’s natural beauty, heritage sites, and investment potential; highlights cultural performances and sustainable tourism initiatives

title: GSAT-7R will strengthen Indian Navy’s surveillance and communication in the Indian Ocean Region
content: The GSAT-7R is the successor to the GSAT-7 “Rukmini,” India’s first dedicated military satellite, launched in 2013. While Rukmini revolutionised naval communications by providing real-time data links across the Arabian Sea and the Bay of Bengal, the GSAT-7R significantly upgrades these capabilities.

title: EBC voters hold the key to Bihar polls, Nitish remains their preferred choice
content: The Mahagatbandhan’s success in the Bihar elections hinges on its ability to break into Nitish Kumar’s loyal vote bank; in the 2020 polls, the victory margin was below 5,000 in 52 seats, and a minor shift in the caste-based political loyalties could change the outcome this time

title: After visit to Vantara, global wildlife committee recommends India pause animal import
content: The reservations of the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora (CITES) committee rose from observations where permit codes did not appropriately reflect the arrangement between the exporting country and India

title: 7 years on, 2 convicted for killing private firm employee in road rage incident
content: Coincidentally, the verdict and sentencing came on the birthday of the victim, Siddarth Koushal, a native of Bihar who was working for a private firm in the city

title: SP renews push for full-fledged AMU centre in Kishanganj as Akhilesh’s Bihar campaign gathers pace
content: Party links demand to Seemanchal’s educational backwardness; calls for strengthening secular and socialist forces

title: SIR 2.0 begins in 9 States, 3 Union Territories
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee alleges ‘silent, invisible rigging’, while the ruling DMK in Tamil Nadu moves SC, terming the exercise ‘arbitrary, unreasonable, and prone to disenfranchising voters’

title: South Western Railway launches ‘MUTS Sahayak’ ticketing scheme at KSR Bengaluru
content: The move is aimed at easing congestion at ticket counters and providing commuters with a quicker, hassle-free option for purchasing tickets, according to officials

title: KIIFB a transformative force for State: CM
content: Kerala Infrastructure Investment Fund Board has paved way for large-scale infrastructure development within Kerala’s acclaimed model of development and social progress: Pinarayi Vijayan

title: Bengaluru among 3 Indian of 33 worldwide to reimagine urban spaces for a hotter future
content: C40 Cities’ Cool Cities Accelerator will help mobilise global action to protect cities such as Ahmedabad, Mumbai, Bengaluru, London against extreme heat.

title: Maharashtra announces ₹2.25 crore each for Jemimah, Smriti and Radha Yadav
content: Coach Amol Muzumdar to receive ₹22.5 lakh; State Cabinet passes resolution to felicitate Women’s World Cup champions

title: Seminar on leadership for school Principals, head teachers begins
content: Representatives from Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, and Lakshadweep are taking part in the regional seminar

title: India, Israel sign MoU to deepen defence cooperation
content: The MoU will facilitate collaboration across multiple domains, including strategic dialogues, training, defence industrial cooperation, research and development, AI, cyber security, and technological innovation

title: Telangana bus-lorry crash: Tipper driver’s attempt to avoid pothole led to collision, says DGP
content: Police are also examining mechanical condition of the tipper lorry, including its engine and braking system, to determine whether any malfunction contributed to the crash; preliminary findings suggest the 10-wheeler tipper was carrying 60 to 70 tonnes of gravel, double its permissible capacity

title: NDA government in Bihar neglected women’s safety, health: Congress
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge says the grand alliance is fully committed to empowering, uplifting women

title: Campaigning ends for 121 seats in the first phase of the Bihar Assembly election
content: With polling set for November 6, BJP Ministers, CMs warn that Bihar will return to the ‘jungle raj of Lalu-Rabri’ if the Opposition wins; Rahul Gandhi, Tejashwi Yadav ask why NDA has failed to provide jobs for Bihar’s youth

title: ECI has no mandate to conduct pan-India SIR, says Manish Tewari
content: Poll body can carry out such an exercise only in certain regions and constituencies, and that too if there is empirical evidence of the need for it, says senior Congress MP

title: Sports inculcate discipline and confidence, says Samagra Shiksha State Project Director
content: Speaking at the State-level School Band Competitions in Vijayawada, B. Srinivasa Rao urges teachers to encourage students to take up sports and band activities, highlighting their role in fostering teamwork, leadership and future success

title: Enumeration phase of Special Intensive Revision kicks off in Kerala, over 2.07 lakh forms distributed
content: Kerala government to convene all-party meet on the SIR on Wednesday. The meeting will be held online.

title: DGCA proposes full airfare refund for cancellations due to medical emergencies
content: Draft norms also make airlines liable for refunds via travel agents; stakeholder feedback invited till November 30

title: Palakkad to host State school science fest from November 7
content: Key event of the science fair will be held at Bharatha Matha school. Four-day event will be held at six venues

title: How a school helped its students develop hygiene, safety habits
content: When teachers at Government Upper Primary School, Manassery, in Kozhikode found that many children were coming to school without even brushing their teeth, they started a Habit lab to instil good habits in them

title: Hyderabad emerging as global command centre for fintech
content: IT Minister Sridhar Babu inaugurates German firm Deutsche Borse Group’s GCC that will create 1,000 high-skilled jobs in its first phase

title: Five IITs, DU, IISc among top 100 institutes in Asia: QS University Rankings
content: IIT-Delhi, which ranked 59 this year, was declared the best Indian institute for the fifth consecutive year.

title: ‘Porunai Museum’ work nearing completion, may be opened by Pongal
content: The 54,000 sq. ft. museum, built at an estimate of ₹56.57 crore will display artefacts from the archaeological excavation sites of Aditchanallur, Korkai, and Sivakalai

title: Minister Narayana urges Apparel Group to explore opportunities in Andhra Pradesh
content: On the second day of his Dubai tour, he  meets top officials of Transworld Group and Tabreed, and invites them to explore the State’s vast potential

title: Government to resolve granite industry issues, says Minister Kollu Ravindra
content: Committee formed with officials and industry representatives to address seigniorage payment concerns; Minister urges factory owners to end strike affecting thousands of workers

title: K-RIDE invites fresh tenders for Mallige Line civil works after L&T contract termination
content: According to K-RIDE officials, the company has now re-invited tenders to complete the pending works of Corridor-2 after the termination by L&T

title: Summit by The Hindu, CPCL to focus on India’s path to a sustainable future
content: The summit aims to bring together leaders, policymakers, and industry experts to foster discussions on environmental responsibility, green innovation, and collaborative policies for a sustainable India

title: APSRTC Union flags overcrowding, manpower shortage in Stree Shakti buses
content: Leaders urge addition of 3,000 buses and 10,000 staff to ease burden on drivers and conductors; seek timely reimbursement of ₹250 crore monthly dues under the women’s free travel scheme

title: A.P. CM discusses potential tie-ups with India’s High Commissioner in U.K.
content: Talks focus on strengthening trade relations, education collaboration, innovation, entrepreneurship, and diaspora engagement

title: ₹113 crore sanctioned for infrastructure development in tribal schools, says Andhra Pradesh Minister Sandhya Rani
content: Of this, ₹83 crore is allocated to tribal ashram schools and ₹30 crore to gurukulam schools, she says

title: Priti Kinar, a transgender candidate of Prashant Kishor’s party, aims high
content: The JSP candidate is pitted against Bhorey’s sitting MLA Sunil Kumar, the State’s Education Minister and a former IPS officer; former JNUSU president Dhananjay Kumar is also in the fray as a CPI (ML)(L) candidate

title: 'Mass chaos': US govt warns shutdown could force airspace closure - what it means
content: US transport secretary Sean Duffy has warned of "mass chaos" in air travel if the government shutdown persists. He highlighted worsening staff shortages among air traffic controllers and TSA personnel, predicting long queues, flight delays, and potential airspace closures.  This shutdown, on track to be the longest, is impacting public services as political deadlock continues.

title: 'Chhath, Halloween & jungle raj': Bihar phase 1 campaign blitz ends — a quick recap
content: Campaigning for Bihar's first phase, covering 121 seats, concluded Tuesday. Top leaders from NDA and INDIA bloc made final pitches. Key issues included Nitish Kumar's appeal, a worker's killing sparking a storm, a JD(U) candidate's arrest, and Chhath Puja politics. "Jungle Raj" echoes and efforts to woo women voters dominated the final day.

title: 'Nobody is bigger than the institution': Mehli Mistry exits Tata Trusts
content: Mehli Mistry has resigned as a trustee of the Tata Trusts, citing his commitment to Ratan N Tata's vision and a desire to prevent controversy. His departure, effective October 27, follows a failed attempt last year to secure a lifetime trustee position. Mistry emphasized transparency and public interest in his farewell letter.

title: Shocking! Mladen Zizovic cause of death: How did football coach pass away mid-game?
content: FK Radnicki 1923 head coach Mladen Zizovic tragically passed away during a Serbian SuperLiga match at the age of 44. The incident halted play, and the game was later abandoned after news of his death spread. Zizovic, a former international player, had recently taken charge of the team. Condolences and prayers for the departed poured from the footballing community.

title: ‘10% control the Army’: Rahul's caste claim at Bihar rally; BJP terms remark disgraceful
content: Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday alleged that 10 percent of the population, referring to upper castes, control the Army and judiciary, while 90 percent from backward communities are excluded from power. He also criticised the Bihar government for unemployment, stating it has turned the state's youth into laborers across the country.

title: Jeff Bezos’ ex-wife’s gift: MacKenzie Scott makes large donation; focus on education
content: MacKenzie Scott has donated $80 million to Howard University, one of the largest single gifts in its history, to support general operations and its College of Medicine. This significant contribution arrives as the university faces delays in federal funding due to a government shutdown. The donation aligns with Scott's ongoing philanthropic focus on diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives.

title: Air traffic congestion: Flight operations impacted in Delhi; IndiGo issues advisory
content: Passengers faced significant flight delays in Delhi on Tuesday due to severe air traffic congestion. IndiGo issued an advisory acknowledging extended wait times on the ground and onboard, apologising for the inconvenience. The airline's teams are working to minimise disruptions and ensure passenger comfort, urging travelers to check for real-time updates.

title: Pakistan's Haris Rauf, once hammered by Virat Kohli, banned by ICC after Asia Cup controversy
content: Pakistan's Haris Rauf faces a two-match ODI ban against South Africa for breaching the ICC Code of Conduct during the Asia Cup final against India. This follows previous demerit points, leading to his suspension. Other players, including India's Suryakumar Yadav and Jasprit Bumrah, also received sanctions for various code of conduct violations.

title: Big AI freebie: ChatGPT Go now free for 12 months in India; how to claim the offer
content: OpenAI is offering ChatGPT Go free for 12 months to users in India starting November 4, 2025. Eligible users include new sign-ups, free-tier users, and existing ChatGPT Go subscribers with accounts in good standing. The promotion provides access to GPT-5, advanced image generation, file uploads, data analysis tools, and custom GPTs at no cost. Users must add a payment method to redeem but won't be charged during the promotional period. This limited-time offer can be redeemed via web, Android, or iOS platforms.

title: Asia Cup controversy: ICC drops the hammer! Full list of players punished and warned
content: Cricket's governing body has handed out penalties to Indian and Pakistani players following contentious moments in the Asia Cup 2025. Suryakumar Yadav and Haris Rauf faced fines and demerit points for bringing the game into disrepute. Rauf's repeated offenses led to a two-match suspension, while Jasprit Bumrah received a warning.

title: Delhi gasps again: Cloud seeding, smog towers, odd-even — will any of it really clear the air?
content: Delhi grapples with its perennial pollution crisis, with various proposed solutions like cloud seeding, odd-even schemes, and smog towers facing scrutiny. Experts emphasize tackling major emission sources, including power, industry, transport, waste, and construction, advocating for cleaner fuels, vehicle electrification, and improved waste management.

title: 'Highway man always high': Congress mocks Nitin Gadkari over Bihar poll promises
content: The Congress on Tuesday criticised Union minister Nitin Gadkari's repeated road construction promises in Bihar, labeling him the "highway man is always high."  Pawan Khera shared a video highlighting Nitin Gadkari's past and present assurances of "world-class" roads, drawing a jibe from Kerala Congress calling him the "new jumla king."

title: Musk vs Altman: OpenAI’s ex chief scientist testifies in court; reveals ‘6-day story’
content: New details reveal OpenAI's CEO Sam Altman's brief ousting stemmed from deep internal mistrust and months of growing tension. Co-founder Ilya Sutskever planned the move for over a year, citing a "pattern of lying" and undermining executives. An employee revolt swiftly reinstated Altman, solidifying his control over the AI giant.

title: Former Bruins forward Milan Lucic lands another PTO, eyes contract with Blues' AHL affiliate
content: Former Boston Bruins player Milan Lucic has secured a new professional try-out contract. He will join the Springfield Thunderbirds, an AHL team affiliated with the St. Louis Blues. This comes after an injury impacted his earlier try-out with the Blues. Lucic aims to earn a full-season contract and showcase his abilities on the ice.

title: Meghan Markle’s friend reveals why Prince Harry looked upset at Dodgers game
content: Meghan Markle enthusiastically celebrated the Dodgers' World Series victory, captured in a video by her friend Kelly McKee Zajfen. While Meghan was seen dancing and cheering, Prince Harry appeared more subdued, sparking fan speculation about his team loyalties. The couple, who moved to California in 2020, were previously seen at Game 4, both sporting Dodgers caps.

title: Charlise Springer breaks silence after Blue Jays' World Series heartbreak
content: The Toronto Blue Jays' World Series dream ended in heartbreak, but George Springer's wife, Charlise, offered a message of gratitude and pride. Her words highlighted the team's resilience and the lasting memories created, reminding fans that baseball's true value lies in connection and shared moments, not just wins. The team vows to 'run it back' next season.

title: Lakers legend praises Bronny James after strong game vs Trail Blazers
content: Bronny James showcased a standout performance for the Los Angeles Lakers against the Portland Trail Blazers, contributing five points and six assists. Lakers legend James Worthy lauded the young guard's game, calling it potentially his best yet. Coach JJ Redick also praised Bronny's defensive intensity and physicality, highlighting his significant contributions in a crucial fourth-quarter stretch.

title: Brittany Mahomes slams “disgusting” Bills fan stunt ahead of Chiefs vs Bills
content: Ahead of the Chiefs-Bills game, a past incident involving Brittany Mahomes and a fan display in Buffalo has resurfaced. She publicly condemned a disrespectful Kermit the Frog puppet mocking Patrick Mahomes, urging for basic decency. This reminder of respect underscores the intense rivalry, proving that even amidst fierce competition, human dignity remains paramount.

title: ‘I can make you smile’: SRK's heartfelt reply to Gambhir; fans go berserk
content: Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan responded to birthday wishes, including a heartfelt message from India head coach Gautam Gambhir. Their exchange, referencing their successful Kolkata Knight Riders partnership, highlighted their bond. He also shared warm replies with cricketers Suresh Raina, Rinku Singh, and Harbhajan Singh, showcasing his signature humor and warmth.

title: More power for Asim Munir? Pakistan plans amendment; revises military command
content: Pakistan's government plans to introduce the 27th Constitutional Amendment, including changes to the command of the armed forces and Article 243. Deputy Prime Minister Ishaq Dar confirmed the amendment will be tabled soon, aiming to strengthen the military's role. The proposal also includes establishing a constitutional court and altering resource distribution.

title: Watch: China’s astronauts grill chicken, steak in space — why it matters
content: China's space program has achieved a milestone with astronauts on Shenzhou-20 and Shenzhou-21 missions using a new space oven to barbecue chicken wings and cook steak. This advanced, smokeless oven significantly reduces cooking time compared to previous international experiments, enhancing astronaut living conditions and morale on long-duration missions.

title: Pakistan to deploy new submarines in 2026 — what it means for India’s naval strategy
content: Pakistan's naval strength is set to significantly increase next year with the induction of eight advanced Chinese-made Hangor-class submarines, featuring air-independent propulsion. This development poses a challenge to India's current conventional submarine capabilities, which are still awaiting their own building plans to commence. The move enhances Pakistan's maritime A2/AD posture.

title: Happy Guru Nanak Jayanti 2025: 50 Gurpurab wishes, messages, quotes & images
content: Guru Nanak Jayanti, also known as Gurpurab, celebrates the birth of Sikhism's founder, Guru Nanak Dev Ji. Celebrations include continuous scripture recitations, processions, and community meals, emphasizing equality and selfless service. The festival falls on Kartik Purnima, this year on November 5, 2025, and followers share wishes and quotes reflecting his teachings.

title: Diabetes-friendly grains that help reverse blood sugar and support weight loss
content: Managing blood sugar and weight is crucial for diabetics. Dr. Pramod Tripathi, a Pune physician, recommends ten low-GI grains. These include barley, foxtail millet, brown top millet, little millet, kodo millet, banyad millet, khapli wheat, amaranth, buckwheat, and quinoa. Incorporating these grains into daily meals supports stable glucose levels and promotes weight management.

title: Trump gushes over Taylor Swift as Travis Kelce stays quiet after Chiefs absence
content: Taylor Swift sparks political and NFL buzz as Donald Trump flips from “I HATE TAYLOR SWIFT” to calling her a “terrific person,” while the White House uses her song in a TikTok. Fans question her absence from the Kansas City Chiefs' game and Travis Kelce stays quiet as online speculation grows around the couple and the moment.

title: Watch: Coach collapses mid-match, dies; players break down in heartbreaking scenes
content: Radnicki 1923 head coach Mladen Zizovic tragically passed away at 44 after collapsing during a Serbian SuperLiga match. The game was halted, and despite medical attention, Zizovic died at a nearby hospital. The match was later abandoned as players and staff reacted with profound grief. Zizovic was 44 at the time of his death.

title: Cleared all police tests but lost job before joining; man wins case in HC
content: A man named Rawal, selected for a Constable job, lost his chance due to judicial custody and a missed 30-day joining deadline. The Punjab and Haryana High Court reinstated his appointment, ruling that rigid adherence to non-statutory instructions shouldn't deny a deserving candidate a job after clearing a tough selection process.

title: Dick Cheney: 'Darth Vader' who hated Donald Trump
content: Cheney died in November 2025 at the age of 84 from complications of pneumonia and heart disease. His family called him “a noble giant of a man.” His critics might call him the architect of ruin. But everyone agrees: he reshaped the American presidency, bent the arc of global history, and never once looked back. Long before Trump normalised authoritarian instincts in public, Cheney operationalised them in secret without even bothering to tweet about it. Cheney might have found redemption among Never-Trumper liberals, but for those who have to live in the world, Darth Vader has no redemption — only the haunting echo of the Imperial March.

title: ‘Ensure elimination of all…’: Himanta links Shahabuddin's son to Laden
content: Assam chief minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has targeted RJD candidate Osama Shahab in Bihar. Sarma drew a controversial comparison between Shahab and Osama Bin Laden. He stated that Shahab's victory would be a setback for Hindus. Sarma also discussed his work in Assam regarding infiltrators and madrasas. He announced plans for a law against multiple marriages in Assam.

title: Who is Michelle Scully? Twitch's global communications head leaving after a year and a half
content: Twitch's Global Head of Communications, Michelle Scully, is departing after a year and a half. Her tenure saw her strengthen the streaming platform's global messaging and voice amidst rapid industry shifts.  Twitch is now seeking a successor to build on this foundation, expanding its reach beyond gaming into broader entertainment and cultural spheres.

title: SBI Clerk Prelims result 2025 declared: Check direct link to download merit list here
content: SBI has declared its Clerk Preliminary Examination results for 2025, with qualified candidates advancing to the Main Examination.  A total of 6,589 Junior Associate vacancies are up for grabs.  Final selection hinges on Mains exam scores and a Language Proficiency Test, ensuring candidates can serve local customers effectively.  Those not selected are encouraged to prepare for future opportunities.

title: Delhi India's 6th most polluted city in October; Dharuhera worst— see full list
content: Delhi ranked sixth most polluted city in India in October, with PM2.5 levels nearly tripling from September. A CREA report highlighted a sharp air quality drop across the Indo-Gangetic Plain, with Dharuhera in Haryana topping the list. The findings underscore the impact of year-round pollution sources beyond seasonal factors.

title: Asia Cup controversy: ICC takes action against Pakistan's Haris Rauf; Suryakumar Yadav fined
content: The International Cricket Council has revealed penalties from the Asia Cup 2025.  Incidents during India versus Pakistan matches led to hearings.  Suryakumar Yadav received a fine and demerit points.  Sahibzada Farhan was given a warning and a demerit point.  Haris Rauf also faced a fine and demerit points for his conduct.

title: Maharashtra: Govt renames Islampur in Sangli to Ishwarpur; issues gazette
content: The Maharashtra government officially renamed Islampur in Sangli to Ishwarpur, with the Survey of India granting final approval. This change, following a legislative assembly proposal, aligns with a state-wide trend of renaming cities. While many residents celebrated the restoration of historical identity, others expressed concern, prioritising development over a name change.

title: 'Bachaa hai': Tej Pratap's 'jhunjhuna' jibe at Tejashwi; threatens to campaign in Raghopur
content: JJD chief Tej Pratap Yadav called his younger brother and Mahagathbandhan's chief ministerial nominee, Tejashwi Yadav, "still a child." He vowed to campaign in Tejashwi's constituency in retaliation for Tejashwi campaigning in his. Tej Pratap also criticised Rahul Gandhi, suggesting he was unfit for politics.

title: Read: How 9/11 shaped the 'Cheney doctrine'
content: On the morning of September 11, 2001, Cheney was in the White House while President George W. Bush was in Florida. As hijacked planes struck New York and Washington, the vice president was ushered into the Presidential Emergency Operations Center beneath the West Wing.

title: Photo shows how Telangana bus crash trapped passengers; 19 dead
content: A horrific bus crash in Chevella left passengers trapped under tons of gravel after a truck collision. Survivors recount the terrifying moments of being buried alive, with rescuers taking nearly an hour to reach them. Many sustained severe injuries, including deep cuts and crushed limbs, in the devastating incident.

title: Junagadh horror: Teen celebrates double murder; used sugar to decompose bodies
content: A 16-year-old boy allegedly murdered his elder brother and sister-in-law in Junagadh, then celebrated with liquor and buried their bodies. Investigators were shocked by his lack of remorse and detailed planning, including using sugar to accelerate decomposition and concealing the pit with cement. The juvenile also confessed to rape and selling stolen jewelry.

title: 4 sixes, 93 runs! Vaibhav Suryavanshi's explosive reply to India A call-up
content: Teenage batting sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi impressed on his India A call-up, scoring a rapid 93 off 67 balls in a Ranji Trophy match. The 14-year-old's fiery innings, featuring nine fours and four sixes, showcased his aggressive batting style. Suryavanshi will also feature in the upcoming Rising Stars Asia Cup in Doha.

title: 'Be ready': Mamata leads anti-SIR rally; Abhishek says 'fear claimed 7 lives'
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee led a massive protest in Kolkata against the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls, alleging "silent invisible rigging" by the BJP and Election Commission. The TMC claims the revision, the first since 2002, is a ploy to manipulate voter lists before the 2026 Assembly elections, while the BJP hails it as a transparency measure.

title: Portuguese Man O’ War with jellyfish-like appearance washes up on UK beaches
content: Dangerous Portuguese Man O' War have washed ashore on popular Welsh beaches. Authorities are warning the public to avoid contact with these venomous creatures. Even dead specimens retain their sting. Efforts are underway to remove them. Sightings have also been reported along other UK coastlines. Beachgoers are urged to exercise extreme caution.

title: Asia Cup final twist! Bumrah punished by ICC; picks up warning
content: Indian pacer Jasprit Bumrah received an official warning from the ICC for breaching the Code of Conduct during the Asia Cup final against Pakistan.  The warning, likely for his animated celebration after dismissing Haris Rauf, resulted in one demerit point.  Rauf himself faced a fine and two demerit points for a similar offense.

title: 'A gentle giant': Sania Mirza reacts as Rohan Bopanna calls time on 22-year career
content: Sania Mirza fondly reflected on her decades-long friendship and partnership with Rohan Bopanna, recalling their first title together when she was just 14. From winning the Nationals to reaching the 2023 Australian Open final, Mirza called Bopanna a “gentle giant” and praised his perseverance as the Coorg-born retired at 45 years old.

title: Russian cardiologist reveals 6 daily habits behind heart failure in healthy people
content: Russian cardiologist Dr Yaranov highlights six hidden lifestyle factors impacting heart health. Poor sleep, air pollution, chronic stress, gum disease, food deserts and gut imbalances silently harm the heart. These modifiable risks can lead to heart failure even in those appearing healthy. Addressing these issues early can protect the heart before clinical disease emerges.

title: What happens to body when one consumes flaxseeds every day for a month
content: Despite their small size, flaxseeds pack quite a punch of nutrients-dietary fiber, omega‑3 fatty acids, an assortment of vitamins, and a handful of essential minerals. When consumed regularly, flaxseeds can trigger positive shifts in your body, most noticeably in digestive function, cardiovascular wellbeing and blood‑sugar regulation

title: It’s 'Mango Lassi' Mamdani morning in Big Apple
content: the toi correspondent from Washington: New Yorkers streamed into polling stations on Tuesday morning with the prospect of the undisputed global capital of finance, skyscrapers, and immense wealth . the Uganda-born Indian son of film-maker Mira Nair and academic Mahmood Mamdani (born in Mumbai) is all set to occupy the City Hall in the ground zero of capitalism, putative Muslim mayor of an iconic city .

title: Chhattisgarh train accident: Toll reaches 8; compensation of 10 lakh announced
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. title: Free agent pickups: Loveland among trio of TEs worth adding
content: the ninth Sunday of the season featured a wild, defenseless slugfest in Buffalo . preseason top tight end Brock Bowers scored three touchdowns and a league-high 43.3 PPR points . cam Little blasted the longest field goal in NFL history .

title: Top-10 upset, Latson's Gamecocks debut, Iowa breakout
content: a top-10 upset helped tip off the opening day of the 2025-26 women's college basketball season . no. 7 Duke fell 58-52 to no. 16 Baylor in the opener of the Oui-Play doubleheader in Paris . defending national champion UConn opens its season Tuesday vs. Louisville .

title: Tracking every NFL trade deadline move: Quinnen Williams to Cowboys, Sauce Gardner to Colts
content: the 2025 trade deadline is Tuesday at 4 p.m. ET . quarterback pat McAfee is blown away by the Colts sending two first-round picks for Sauce Gardner . the Cowboys kicked off the action with a deal for Logan Wilson .

title: CFP Bubble Watch: What to expect ahead of the committee's first ranking
content: the college football playoff selection committee will reveal its first ranking at 8 p.m. ET . teams with Would be in status below are featured in this week's top 12 projection . the 12-member selection committee doesn't always agree with the Allstate Playoff Predilection .

title: 🏀 Big questions to impact men's March Madness
content: the first in-season projections of the 2026 March Madness field of 68 will release Nov. 11 . the reasons are that the Big Ten and the SEC have more contenders to chase the respective league favorites . Bracketology is a prisoner of probability and it's simply more likely that Houston and Duke ride the wave of their respective conferences to a No. 1 seed .

title: Resetting the CFP tiers after Week 10 and projecting the first bracket
content: two top-10 teams fell on the road to unranked opponents . a third fell to a lower-ranked team . two-thirds of the 2025 college football season done, we now shift into Playoff Hyperdrive .
